title: Instructional Design Theory and Research-Based Practice: Applying Project-Based Inquiry

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of learning theories and instructional design, plus project management experience
context.additional_context: In-service professionals critically analyze instructional design theories in social contexts and apply them to real projects using collaboration tools in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can identify at least three core components of instructional design theory (context, perspective, issues, methodology, values).
Learners can write a report analyzing the impact of humanistic perspectives and societal assumptions in social contexts on instructional design theory.
Learners can prototype an instructional design framework applicable to corporate training settings using a PBL (Project-Based Learning) approach.

resources: Digital Collaboration Platforms (Notion/Miro), Case Study Database, and Core Instructional Design Theory Literature Summaries

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
